title: Protocol to derive human trophoblast stem cells directly from primed pluripotent stem cells
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Passaging hPSCs for derivation of hTSCs
Timing: 30–60 min
Day -1.
Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1] shows the overall approach, including the standard strategy and BMP4 strategy, to derive human trophoblast stem cells (hTSCs) from human pluripotent stem cells (hPSCs). These following steps provide the detailed information to prepare single-cell suspensions of hPSCs from colonies.

Figure 1. The conversion strategies for derivation of hTSPS cells from primed hPSCs
Overview of conversion strategies to generate and characterize hTSCs (hTSPS cells) from primed PSCs (hPSCs) in the absence (Standard strategy) (A) or presence of BMP4 (BMP4 strategy) (B).
Observe the morphology of hPSCs and confirm hPSCs at 80%–90% confluency under the microscope.
Remove the medium from culture plate (6 well).
Wash hPSCs with 1 mL DMEM/F12 basic medium per well.
Remove DMEM/F12 basic medium from the well.
Add 600 μL Accutase per well to dissociate into individual cells for 8 min at 37°C and 5% CO2.
8 min later, observe the hPSCs which are the single formation and floating.
Add 600 μL DMEM/F12 basic medium into the well and pipette the cell suspension gently.
Transfer the cell suspension to a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube and centrifuge cells at 200 g for 5 min.
Remove the supernatant and resuspend cells with 1.5 mL mTeSR1 medium 10 μM Y27632.
Pipette the cells gently to ensure single-cell suspension.
Count the cell number using the cell count chamber using trypan blue.
Seed 4×105 cells per well of hPSCs in mTeSR1 medium plus 10 μM Y27632 on the matrigel-coated 6-well plates at 37°C and 5% CO2.
Derivation of hTSCs by the standard strategy
Timing: 10–12 days
These steps describe the derivation of hTSCs by the standard strategy. During the conversion process, the cells are cultured at 37°C and 5% CO2.

One day later (day 0), remove the mTeSR1 medium and wash hPSCs with 1 mL DMEM/F12 basic medium per well.
Add 2 mL hTSC medium per well and observe the morphology of hPSCs (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1918-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. hTSPS cells are efficiently derived from primed hPSCs
(A) Morphology of cells derived from H1 hESCs under TS medium by the standard strategy on the indicated days. Scale bar, 200 μm.
(B) The tool (upper panel) and schematic diagram (bottom panel) of picking hTSC colonies. The glass pipet (Left) and vertical sharp glass pipet (Right).
(C) Morphology of cells derived from H1 hESCs under TS medium plus BMP4 by the BMP4 strategy on the indicated days. Scale bar, 200 μm.
(D) Morphology of hTS cells (named hTSPS cells) derived from H1 hESCs.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every 2 days.
On day 3, confluency of the transdifferentiated cells reaches about 90–100% (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
Remove the medium and add 1 mL per well 0.5 mM EDTA in the well for 8 min at 37°C.
8 min later, observe the morphology of cells under the microscope, the cell-cell interactions should become loose.
Remove EDTA and add 3 mL fresh TSC medium in the well.
Pipette the cells gently and passage the cells into the new matrigel-coated 6-well plate at 1:3 ratio.
Add 1 mL per well fresh hTSC medium to every well.
Note: The incubation time with 0.5 mM EDTA is appropriate when cell-cell interactions become loose, but the cells become non-floating.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every 2 days.
On day 5, repeat step 16 to passage the cells with 0.5 mM EDTA at 1:3 ratio (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
Note: This step describes the passaging of the converted cells, similar to step 16.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every 2 days for a week.

On day 7–8, observe the morphology of the transdifferentiated cells and confirm appearance of hTSC-like colonies (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
Note: The appearance time of hTSC-like colonies may vary depending on the cell lines, initial cell density, and passaging time point.
On day 10–12, the hTSC-like colonies should be observed and can be picked for purification and characterization (Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A and 2B).
Remove the medium from the culture plates and add 1 mL per well DMEM/F12 basic medium to wash the cells.
Remove DMEM/F12 basic medium and add 2 mL fresh hTSC medium.
Note: Before picking colonies, the microscope, disposable glass pipets, and its surrounding environment are wiped with 75% alcohol, and an alcohol lamp should be lit next to the microscope to maintain sterilization. The glass pipets are burned into a vertical and sharp shape using the alcohol lamp (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B). New 12-well plates are coated with matrigel for at least 1 h at 37°C.
Burn the glass pipets using alcohol lamp and open the plate.
Observe the hTSC-like colonies under the microscope and gently scrape these colonies from the well along these colonies using the glass pipets.
Shake the culture plate to collect these scraped colonies.
Transfer the cell suspension to the new matrigel-coated 12-well plate at 37°C and 5% CO2.
Note: The number of hTSC-like colonies may vary depending on the cell lines. According to the colony number, the cell suspension is transferred at 1:1–1:3 ratio.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every day.
Scrape Some non-hTS cells by the glass pipets.
Note: There may be some non-hTS cells in these hTSC colonies in the 12-well plate.
Passage the purified hTSC-like cells at 80%–90% confluency with 600 μL TrypLE Express dissociation solution per well for 8–10 min at 37°C.

Note: Many steps of the cell dissociation using TrypLE Express are similar to accutase. Please see the above description.
10 min later, collect the cell suspension into 1.5 mL centrifuge tubes and centrifuge cells at 200 g for 5 min.
Remove the supernatant and resuspend cells with 1 mL hTSC medium.
Pipette the cells gently and passage the cells in the new matrigel-coated 6-well plate at 1:1 ratio.
Add the fresh hTSC medium to a total of 2 mL per well in 6-well plate and culture the cells at 37°C and 5% CO2.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every day.
Passage routinely the purified human TSC-like cells using TrypLE Express every three days at 1:3 ratio.
Note: If these cells grow slowly at the beginning, the culture days can be extended appropriately. The purified human TSC-like cells are named human TSPS cells in the later description.
Derivation of hTSCs by the BMP4 strategy
Timing: 10–12 days
These steps describe the derivation of hTSCs in the presence of BMP4. BMP4 promotes induction efficiency of hTSCs from hPSCs. Thus, some steps for derivation of hTSCs using the BMP4 strategy are different from the steps using the standard strategy. The detailed information for the BMP4 strategy is provided in the following steps. During the conversion process, the cells are cultured at 37°C and 5% CO2.
One day later (day 0), aspirate the mTeSR1 medium and wash hPSCs with DMEM/F12 basic medium.
Add 2 mL hTSC medium plus 10 ng/mL BMP4 per well (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C).
Change the fresh hTSC medium plus 10 ng/mL BMP4 every 2 days.
On day 3, observe the morphology of the transdifferentiated cells and confirm appearance of hTSC-like colonies (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C).
Note: The appearance time of hTSC-like cells using the BMP4 strategy is earlier than that of standard strategy.

Passage the cells at 90–100% confluency using 0.5 mM EDTA for 8 min at 37°C.
Change the fresh hTSC medium plus 10 ng/mL BMP4 every 2 days.
On day 5, repeat step 26 to passage the cells with 0.5 mM EDTA at 1:3 ratio.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every 2 days for a week.
On day 10–12, passage the hTSC-like cells using TrypLE Express for 8 min at 1:3 ratio (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C).
Note: On day 10, almost all transdifferentiated cells will exhibit hTSC-like morphology. Therefore, these cells do not need to be picked manually and can be directly passaged using TrypLE Express.
Add the fresh hTSC medium to a total of 2 mL per well in 6-well plate and culture the cells at 37°C and 5% CO2.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every day.
Routinely passage routinely the human TSC-like cells (BMP4 strategy) using TrypLE Express every three days at 1:3 ratio.
Note: If these cells grow slowly at the beginning, the culture days can be extended appropriately. These purified human TSC-like cells are named human TSPSB cells using the BMP4 strategy.
Passaging and cryopreservation of hTSPS cells
Timing: 30 min
hTSC-like cells can be derived from primed hPSCs by the standard and BMP4 strategies. These hTSPS and hTSPSB cells need to be expanded, stored, and characterized as bona fide hTSCs. These steps describe the passaging and cryopreservation of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells.
For passaging of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells, confluency of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells should reach 80%–90%.
Remove the medium from the well of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells.
Wash hPSCs with 1 mL DMEM/F12 basic medium per well and remove DMEM/F12 from the well.
Add 600 μL TrypLE Express per well for 8 min at 37°C and 5% CO2.

8 min later, shake the plate and add 600 μL DMEM/F12 basic medium into the well.
Pipette the cell suspension gently and transfer the cell suspension to a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube.
Centrifuge cells at 200 g for 5 min and remove the supernatant.
Add 1.5 mL hTSC medium and resuspend cells gently.
Seed the cells at 1:3 ratio in a total of 2 mL hTSC medium per well on the matrigel-coated 6-well plate at 37°C and 5% CO2.
Change the fresh hTSC medium every day.
Passage the hTSPS and hTSPSB cells using TrypLE Express every three days at 1:3 ratio.
For cryopreservation of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells, confluency of the cells should reach 80%–90%.
Repeat step 34a-f and add 1 mL Cell Banker 2 to resuspend cells.
Transfer the cell suspension to Cryotube vial.
Store the vial at −80°C and subsequently liquid nitrogen.
Characterization of hTSPS cells
Timing: 10 min (morphology), 48 h (marker expression)
Bona fide hTSCs maintain hTSC morphology, express hTSC markers (GATA3/KRT7/TEAD4/TP63) (Lee et al., 2016[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib5]), and differentiate into extravillous cytotrophoblast cells (EVT) and syncytiotrophoblast cells (STB) (Okae et al., 2018[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib6]). Therefore, the hTSPS and hTSPSB cells should exhibit these characteristics. The following steps describe the characterization of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells.
The morphology of hTSPS and hTSPSB cells is captured by the microscope (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D).
The expression of hTSC markers GATA3/KRT7/TEAD4/TP63 and hESC marker OCT4 is validated using immunostaining (Figures 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]A and 3B). See key resources table[href=https://www.wicell.org#key-resources-table] for the antibody information.

Differentiation of hTSPS cells
Timing: 6–8 days
This step describes how to induce differentiation of the hTSCs into extravillous cytotrophoblast cells (EVT) and syncytiotrophoblast cells (STB).
For EVT differentiation of hTSPS cells (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]C).
Remove the medium from hTSPS cells on the 6-well plate at 80%–90% confluency and wash with DPBS.
Treat the cells with 600 μL TrypLE Express for 8 min at 37°C.
8 min later, add 600 μL DMEM/F12.
Transfer the cell suspension to 1.5 mL centrifuge tube, and centrifuge at 200 g for 5 min.
Discard supernatant and resuspend cells with 1.5 mL pre-warmed EVT1 medium.
Pipette the cells evenly and count the cell number using the cell count chamber.
Seed 4×105 hTSPS cells per well on the matrigel-coated 6-well plate, and add EVT1 medium to a total of 2 mL per well for 3 days at 37°C and 5% CO2.
After 3 days, Remove EVT1 medium and add EVT2 medium for the next 3 days.
On day 6 to 8, these EVT cells are collected for analysis.
For STB differentiation of hTSPS cells (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]D).
Repeat step 38a-d, and resuspend cells with 1.5 mL pre-warmed STB medium.
seed 1×105 hTSPS cells per well on the matrigel-coated 6-well plate, and add STB medium to a total of 2 mL per well for 3 days at 37°C and 5% CO2.
Change the fresh STB medium for the next 3 days.
On day 6, STB cells are collected for analysis.
